title: Tusculum's Robinson runs for 250 yards
text:
Copyright 2015 Journal Media Group. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. Show Caption Previous Next 
Isaac Robinson broke Tusculum College's single-game rushing record with 250 yards in a 20-0 victory at Brevard on Saturday at Memorial Stadium. 
Robinson shaved five yards off the record established by Walter Dette on Nov. 18, 1930 against Biltmore (now UNC Asheville). Robinson broke the record on his last carry of the game, a seven-yard touchdown run with 2:05 left in the contest. 
Robinson also set a single-game mark with 39 carries, breaking the record set by B.J. Spradlin in 2012. 
The Pioneers (2-3, 1-2 South Atlantic Conference) snapped a three-game losing streak and won at Brevard for the first time since 2007. It was Tusculum's first shutout in the SAC since joining the league in 1998. 
Tusculum, which entered the contest with the No. 3 pass offense in NCAA Division II at 383.8 yards per game, was forced to run the ball due to the inclement weather conditions which included high winds and heavy rain. 
The Pioneers finished with 325 yards, including 305 on the ground on 55 attempts. 
Tusculum limited Brevard (0-5, 0-2) to 169 yards, recorded four sacks and forced three turnovers (two fumbles, one interception). Copyright 2015 Journal Media Group. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed.
